reviewText: I bought this movie for a friend and it showed up just in time to give to him. It is a great movie!
a little dissapointed in the content, DVD not as good as the trailer suggests, have seen much better surfing documentries.  wouldn't recommend it
Perhaps the best surf movie to come out since Five Summer Stories.  Excellent work.
best surf movie Ive seen in 30 years. A must see
Got this for my surfer husband.  He liked it so much, he plans on watching it again and again. (Unusual for him - so it must be great!!)
What a great movie!!!
wow great documentary on history of surfing and surfboards

I love surf documentaries, but this documentary has almost nothing to bring. The narration reads like slideshow bullet points, and the rest of the dvd is slow motion surfing highlights; which is fine, but don't call it a documentary.  It would make a great screensaver for your computer at least because the video is good quality.

Great DVD, one for the Library, must see if you are into surfing or any water sport.
Jack McCoy did a great job!
I have been watching surf movies since high school 50 years ago and this is the best.  Great present for friends addicted to surf culture.
Camera work and the advances creative underwater technology provide an amazing perspective that only our underwater neighbors, surfers and surf photogs have experienced
This movie is epic.  Saw it in the theaters and then again when i was surfing in Puerto Escondido.  Everyone I've talked to that has seen it had nothing but good things to say about it.
Exactly what I ordered and wanted.
I think the music on this cd makes you mesmerized even more by the fantastic surfing footage. Fabulous!
Wonderfully diverse  and historical footage/story of Surfing from origins to the present. Shows surfings amazing evolution and cultural influence.
I know this is a great movie, but I can't find it.  I don't think it was sent, but I'm not sure - still looking.

Excellent history on surfing by Jack McCoy.
Good job, Braddah!
Aloha
Awesome Film !!! Changed my Life !!!
My current favorite surf movie.  Presenting the story as a history of surfing and surf boards is more interesting than the standard cowabunga content.
Excellent movie about the surfing sport history. I would have a PART 2 movie...some important history and surfers where left out.

I liked the film and learned a few things. I read bad reviews on the soundtrack etc, but those details can be subjective. I'm not a filmmaker, so I can't speak to where it ranks. It felt historical and non surfing people can learn a lot about surfing from this film. I did notice a whole branch missing from the surfing tree...SUP surfing you know Ku Hoe he'e nalu. The wise Hawaiians you quote and have commentating in your film SUP surf. A missed opportunity to tell a story that is alive and evolving around the world. That's all I wanted to add. Aloha.
Excellent in every respect...I saw it on DirectTV and was so impressed. I ordered it for my nephew who surfs and skateboards.
